content.question: What am I looking for in a job?
content.answer: The ability work with a modern tech stack (ideally React based), where I can add maximise my value in a senior role. I would like a voice when it comes technology strategy, team processes and coding standards. I also find great enjoyment in helping others grow around me, through line-management or informal tutelage.

content.question: What are my best professional qualities?
content.answer: Leading a team from the front, delivering high quality solution and efficient problem solving mentality.

content.question: Am I open to contracting roles?
content.answer: Certainly, depending on location, remote working options and compensation. For duration of contract, ideally would not under 6 months.

content.question: What job locations would be acceptable?
content.answer: Within commutable distance from SP11 - Newbury, Basingstoke, Southampton, Swindon, Reading, Bracknell, Oxford, London - see below

content.question: What about London based roles?
content.answer: Yes, with caveats. I'm currently ~2 hours each way from London, so commuting 5 days a week is a non-starter. Remote-working options would be a must, with easy transport links from Waterloo/Clapham Junction.

content.question: What level of Line Management experience do I have?
content.answer: I started whilst at IBM with a single developer. When working at Cognito I managed a multifaceted team of 11. I was responsible for goal setting, 1-to-1's, appraisals and salary review. This has continued into my current role at MMT, where at manage a smaller group many of them are themselves line managers.

content.question: What experience do I have leading a team?
content.answer: I have lead teams on a day-to-day basis on my last two roles. This consists of defining team processes, engaging with stakeholders, delivering estimates, planning work and ensuring deliverables are met.

techStack.title: Tech stack
paragraph: This site is built with React ‚öõÔ∏è and Gatsby üçæ, using styled components from Emotion üë©‚Äçüé§.
React is a Javascript library maintained by Facebook that is used for constructing user interfaces.
Gatsby is a React-based static site generator. This, alongside code splitting, intelligent image loading and asset optimisation leads to incredibly fast page loading times.
Emotion is a library designed for writing CSS in JavaScript. This removes the need for a global style-sheet and allows for co-location of style nearer to where it used.
I have created a 'Atomic Hierarchy' to aid abstraction and reuse throughout the application. In the future this Component Library may be published in a open-source NPM repository.
All code (apart from React/Gatsby/Emotion dependencies) is my own and has been written from scratch.
